definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
Proletarier aller Länder, vereinigt euch!/Workers of the world, unite!
pinyin: quan2 shi4 jie4 wu2 chan3 zhe3 lian2 he2 qi3 lai5
containing_words.word: 全世界无产者联合起来

sentences.english: The proles, it suddenly occurred to him, had remained in this condition.
sentences.chinese: 他突然想到，无产者仍旧是这样。

sentences.english: It was not desirable that the proles should have strong political feelings.
sentences.chinese: 无产者不该有什么强烈的政治情感。

sentences.english: The future belonged to the proles.
The proletarians have nothing to lose but their chains . They have a world to win.
sentences.chinese: 无产者失去的只是锁链，他们获得的将是整个世界。

sentences.english: If there is hope… it lies in the proles.
sentences.chinese: 如果有希望的话，希望在无产者身上。

sentences.english: Not only should proletarians emancipate themselves but also the whole mankind.
sentences.chinese: 无产者不仅要解放他们自己，而且要解放全人类。

sentences.english: The Party claimed, of course, to have liberated the proles from bondage.
sentences.chinese: 当然，党宣称已把无产者从枷锁中解放出来了。

sentences.english: This is the comprador class by the bureaucracy and the civilian population constitutes a proletarian mode of the dumbbell.
sentences.chinese: 这是由官僚买办阶级与平民无产者构成的哑铃模式。

sentences.english: The proletarians have nothing to lose but their chains.
sentences.chinese: 无产者在这个革命中失去的只是锁链。

sentences.english: The proletarians have nothing to lose but their chains. They have a world to win.
sentences.chinese: 无产者失去的只是锁链，他们获得的将是整个世界。
